intro: Rondeletia brachycarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Rondeletia brachycarpa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
